title.value: Disentangling poststroke cognitive deficits and their neuroanatomical correlates through combined multivariable and multioutcome lesion-symptom mapping
title.justification: The title is explicitly given at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Disentangling poststroke cognitive deficits and their neuroanatomical correlates through combined multivariable and multioutcome lesion-symptom mapping

extractions.description: This paper explores poststroke cognitive deficits and their neuroanatomical correlates through a combined multivariable and multioutcome lesion-symptom mapping approach, implemented with canonical correlation analysis (CCA) and support vector regression (SVR). It evaluates how CCA can complement traditional LSM techniques to better relate brain infarcts to cognitive impairments, specifically in verbal memory functions.

type.justification: The paper conducts a proof-of-concept study on 1075 patients, using real data to test how CCA and SVR can be applied to lesion-symptom mapping, making it empirical research.
type.quote: We performed a proof-of-concept study on 1075 patients with acute ischemic stroke...

name.justification: The paper focuses on cognitive deficits poststroke using neuroimaging and mapping techniques, which falls under cognitive neuroscience.
name.quote: Studies in patients with brain lesions play a fundamental role in unraveling the brain's functional anatomy. Lesion-symptom mapping (LSM) techniques can relate lesion location to cognitive performance.

name.justification: The study employs imaging techniques to map lesions to cognitive deficits, fitting within the neuroimaging domain.
name.quote: Lesion-symptom mapping (LSM) techniques can relate lesion location to cognitive performance.

name.justification: SVR is used in the study as a multivariable LSM method applied to analyze cognitive deficits.
name.quote: we performed SVR region of interest (ROI)-based LSM (SVR-ROI), which is a well-established multivariable LSM method

is_contributed.justification: SVR is not introduced as a new model in the paper; it is used as a known technique.
is_contributed.quote: we performed SVR region of interest (ROI)-based LSM (SVR-ROI), which is a well-established multivariable LSM method

is_executed.justification: SVR was executed to analyze lesion data and cognitive scores as part of the study.
is_executed.quote: we performed SVR region of interest (ROI)-based LSM (SVR-ROI)

is_compared.justification: SVR results were compared with those from CCA to demonstrate the novelty of the latter approach.
is_compared.quote: We performed a proof-of-concept study... to explore whether addition of CCA to a multivariable single-outcome LSM approach (support vector regression) could identify infarct locations associated with deficits...

referenced_paper_title.value: Multivariate lesion-symptom mapping using support vector regression
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced SVR technique in lesion-symptom mapping matches known literature.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Multivariate lesion-symptom mapping using support vector regression.

name.justification: CCA is used as the primary novel approach for multioutcome lesion-symptom mapping in this paper.
name.quote: To overcome this challenge, we implemented canonical correlation analysis (CCA) as combined multivariable and multioutcome LSM approach.

is_contributed.justification: CCA itself is not a novel contribution; it is applied in a new context for this study.
is_contributed.quote: To overcome this challenge, we implemented canonical correlation analysis (CCA) as combined multivariable and multioutcome LSM approach.

is_executed.justification: CCA was executed to analyze lesion data and cognitive scores as part of the study.
is_executed.quote: CCA inherently creates the canonical modes based on strength of both positive and negative coefficients.

is_compared.justification: CCA's effectiveness was compared to traditional LSM techniques like SVR.
is_compared.quote: We performed a proof-of-concept study... to explore whether addition of CCA to a multivariable single-outcome LSM approach... could identify infarct locations associated with deficits...

referenced_paper_title.value: Relations between two sets of variates
referenced_paper_title.justification: CCA is a well-known method, originally introduced by Hotelling, and applied in this novel context.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Relations between two sets of variates. Biometrika, Hotelling.

name.justification: The SVLT is used to evaluate verbal memory functions as a key part of the study's methodology.
name.quote: three well-defined verbal memory functions (encoding, consolidation, retrieval) based on four verbal memory subscores derived from the Seoul Verbal Learning Test

referenced_paper_title.justification: The SVLT is part of the SNSB as per the referenced work.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Seoul neuropsychological screening battery (SNSB) by Kang & Na.

name.justification: Scikit-learn was used for conducting the CCA analysis as stated in the paper.
name.quote: Region of interest-based analyses using CCA were performed using the Python 3.7 environment using the packages Scikit-learn (version 0.22.1; Abraham et al., 2014).

referenced_paper_title.value: Machine learning for neuroimaging with scikit-learn
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides an overview of scikit-learn's application in neuroimaging, related to its use in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Machine learning for neuroimaging with scikit-learn.
